{"step_by_step_thinking": "The jack-knife position is mentioned in several documents, but the one that directly relates to the question is Document [0]. It describes a case where a man was found dead in a jack-knife position inside a tire repair shop. His death was determined to be due to accidental postural asphyxia secondary to intoxication by alcohol. Postural asphyxia occurs when the position of the body prevents someone from breathing properly. Therefore, keeping in a jack-knife position for a long time can lead to death by positional asphyxia.", "answer_choice": "C. Positional asphyxia"}
